intro: Scabiosa flava, commonly known as the lesser scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often hairy and branching. Scabiosa flava is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies due to its nectar-rich blossoms.
